input: Usually, I don't think notation and math matters that much.
translatedText: 通常，我认为符号和数学并不那么重要。

input: Don't get me wrong, I enjoy a bad notation rant as much as the next guy, and there are clearly a few simple changes to our conventions that could speed up learning for math students everywhere.
translatedText: 别误会我的意思，我和其他人一样喜欢糟糕的符 号咆哮，而且显然对我们的惯例进行一些简单的 改变可以加快世界各地数学学生的学习速度。

input: But at the end of the day, notation, good or bad, is just not the point of math.
translatedText: 但归根结底，符号，无论好坏，都不是数学的重点。

input: Even the most carefully designed symbols and syntax will fail to capture the underlying visual that constitutes understanding, so I figure it's better to just spend time focusing on that underlying essence and let the symbols be what they are in peace.
translatedText: 即使是最精心设计的符号和语法也无法捕捉构成 理解的潜在视觉效果，因此我认为最好花时间 专注于潜在的本质，让符号保持平静的样子。

input: But that said, when unintuitive notation actively stalls the gears of learning, my disposition on the matter hardens up a little bit.
translatedText: 但话虽如此，当不直观的符号主动阻碍学习的 齿轮时，我对此事的态度就会变得坚定一些。

input: In particular, I'm thinking of one threesome of syntax which, when you stop and think about it, is an egregious source of friction in math education everywhere.
translatedText: 特别是，我正在考虑一种语法三元组，当你停下来思考它 时，它是世界各地数学教育中一个令人震惊的摩擦来源。

input: If you take the fact that 2 multiplied by itself 3 times equals 8, for example, we have three separate ways to explain that relationship.
translatedText: 例如，如果 2 乘以 3 等于 8，我 们可以用三种不同的方式来解释这种关系。

input: 2 cubed equals 8, with a superscript.
translatedText: 2 的立方等于 8，带上标。

input: The cube root of 8 is 2, with a squaggly radical symbol.
translatedText: 8 的立方根是 2，带有波浪形的根号。

input: And the log base 2 of 8 equals 3, which we write using the word log itself.
translatedText: 以 2 为底的 8 的对数等于 3，我们用 log 这个词本身来写。

input: What the hell do these three ways of writing the same fact have to do with each other?
translatedText: 这三种书写同一事实的方式到底有什么关系呢？

input: Making up syntax for a concept is fine, but don't do it in three completely different ways for the same concept and force students to learn every rule about that concept three separate times.
translatedText: 为一个概念编写语法固然很好，但不要对同一 个概念以三种完全不同的方式进行编写，并迫 使学生分三次学习有关该概念的每条规则。

input: It's like it's a different language.
translatedText: 就好像这是一种不同的语言。

input: This way of writing things isn't just counterintuitive, it's counter-mathematical, since rather than making seemingly different facts look the same, which is what math should do, it takes three facts which should obviously be the same and makes them look artificially different.
translatedText: 这种书写方式不仅违反直觉，而且违反数学，因为它不是让 看似不同的事实看起来相同（数学应该这样做），而是需要 三个显然应该相同的事实，并人为地使它们看起来不同。

input: Just think about how confusing logarithms were the first time you learned about them.
translatedText: 想想你第一次了解对数时是多么令人困惑。

input: This is, of course, a known issue, and the internet has no shortage of people raising the same concern with suggestions for a better notation.
translatedText: 当然，这是一个已知的问题，互联网上不乏 提出同样担忧并提出更好表示法建议的人。

input: But recently I stumbled across a math exchange post with a suggestion so lovely, so symmetrical, so utterly reasonable, that I just have to share it.
translatedText: 但最近我偶然发现了一篇数学交流文章，其中的建议 非常可爱，非常对称，非常合理，我不得不分享它。

input: For a relationship like 2 cubed equals 8, take a triangle and write 2 in the lower left, 3 on the top, and 8 on the lower right.
translatedText: 对于像 2 的立方等于 8 这样的关系，取一个三角形并 在左下角写上 2，在顶部写上 3，在右下角写上 8。

input: To express the operation 2 cubed, remove that bottom right corner.
translatedText: 要表达 2 的立方运算，请删除右下角。

input: The symbol as a whole represents the value that should go in the missing corner.
translatedText: 该符号作为一个整体代表了应该放入缺失角的值。

input: To express log base 2 of 8, which is asking the question 2 to the what equals 8, remove the top number.
translatedText: 要表达以 8 为底的对数 2（即询问 2 等于 8 的问题），请删除顶部的数字。

input: The symbol as a whole represents the value that should go in the missing corner.
translatedText: 该符号作为一个整体代表了应该放入缺失角的值。

input: To express the cubed root of 8, which is saying what number to the third power equals 8, remove the bottom left corner.
translatedText: 要表达 8 的立方根，即表示什么数 的三次方等于 8，请删除左下角。

input: The symbol as a whole represents the value that should go in the missing corner.
translatedText: 该符号作为一个整体代表了应该放入缺失角的值。

input: In other words, all three operations are completely symmetrically represented.
translatedText: 换句话说，所有三个操作都是完全对称表示的。

input: This triangle deserves a name, and a friend of mine at Khan Academy decided that we should call it the triangle of power.
translatedText: 这个三角形值得一个名字，我在可汗学院的一 个朋友决定我们应该将其称为权力三角形。

input: The definition alone is mildly pleasing, but where it gets fun is when you see how much smoother all of the different operations become.
translatedText: 光是这个定义就让人比较满意，但是当你看到所有 不同的操作变得更加流畅时，它就变得有趣了。

input: In our current notation, there are 6 different ways to express the various inverse operations.
translatedText: 在我们当前的表示法中，有 6 种不同的方式来表达各种逆运算。

input: Most of these are memorized as separate entities, some are rarely even talked about, and there's no discernible pattern even though all of them describe the same basic idea.
translatedText: 其中大多数都是作为单独的实体来记忆的，有些甚至很少被谈论， 并且即使它们都描述了相同的基本思想，也没有可辨别的模式。

input: But students still have to spend 6 times the effort to memorize each one, are 6 times more likely to make a mistake, and have 6 separate opportunities to decide math is dumb and boring and conducive to failure and why don't I just go study art instead?
translatedText: 但学生仍然需要花费 6 倍的努力来记住每一项，犯错误的可能 性要高出 6 倍，并且有 6 次单独的机会来决定数学是愚 蠢的、无聊的、容易失败的，为什么我不去学习呢？ 艺术代替？

input: With the triangle of power, all these operations follow the same pattern.
translatedText: 在权力三角中，所有这些操作都遵循相同的模式。

input: Our brains are really good at picking up on patterns like this, and you can much more easily imagine a smooth mental image associated with the property.
translatedText: 我们的大脑非常擅长识别这样的模式，你可以更 容易地想象出与房产相关的流畅的心理图像。

input: There's even kind of an aesthetic pleasure to this, and who knows, maybe more of the artistically inclined students would look favorably upon math long enough to see just how valuable their intuitions really are in the science.
translatedText: 这甚至有一种审美上的乐趣，谁知道呢，也许 更多有艺术倾向的学生会长期看好数学，看 看他们的直觉在科学中到底有多么有价值。

input: Let's take another property, like the idea that a to the x times a to the y equals a to the x plus y.
translatedText: 让我们采用另一个属性，例如a除以 x乘以a除以y等于a除以x加y。

input: The corresponding fact for logarithms is that log of x times y equals log of x plus log of y.
translatedText: 对数的相应事实是 x 的 log 乘以 y 等于 x 的 log 加 y 的 log。

input: When you write this with the triangle of power, it's a little easier to see that both of these expressions are really saying the same thing.
translatedText: 当你用权力三角形来写这个时，你会更容易 看出这两个表达式实际上说的是同一件事。

input: Remember, the symbol as a whole represents the number at the missing corner, so the top expression is saying that when you multiply two numbers that belong on the bottom right of the triangle, it corresponds with adding the numbers that belong to the top.
translatedText: 请记住，该符号作为一个整体表示缺失角处的数字， 因此顶部表达式表示，当您将属于三角形右下角的两 个数字相乘时，它相当于将属于顶部的数字相加。

input: But that's also what the lower expression is saying.
translatedText: 但这也是下面表达的意思。

input: When you multiply the numbers at the bottom right, it corresponds with adding numbers that belong to the top.
translatedText: 当您将右下角的数字相乘时，它 相当于将属于顶部的数字相加。

input: To help students with this, you could draw inside of the triangle, saying that when the lower left is constant, the numbers at the top like to add, while the bottom right numbers like to multiply.
translatedText: 为了帮助学生解决这个问题，你可以在三角形 的内部画一个，表示当左下角不变时，顶部的 数字喜欢加法，而右下角的数字喜欢乘法。

input: What about when a different corner stays constant, like the top?
translatedText: 当另一个角保持不变（例如顶部）时会怎样？

input: Well in this case, you'd write a multiplication sign in both the bottom corners, because with exponents and radicals, multiplication turns into multiplication.
translatedText: 在这种情况下，您需要在两个底角写一个乘号 ，因为对于指数和根式，乘法会变成乘法。

input: The natural question that a student might ask from here is if there's an analogous rule for when the lower right stays constant.
translatedText: 学生可能会从这里问的自然问题是，当右 下角保持不变时是否存在类似的规则。

input: There is!
translatedText: 有！

input: You have to introduce a new operation, which for the sake of this video, I'll call O+, where aO plus b equals one over one over a plus one over b.
translatedText: 你必须引入一个新的操作，为了这个视频，我将其称为 O+ ，其中 aO 加 b 等于一除以 a 加一除以 b。

input: This is not actually a ridiculous thing to introduce, since it comes up in physics all the time, like when you're computing parallel resistance.
translatedText: 引入这实际上并不是一件荒谬的事情，因为它一直 在物理学中出现，就像当你计算并联电阻时一样。

input: To get that symbol, you could say that when the lower right number stays constant, the top numbers like to get O-plussed together, and the bottom left numbers like to get multiplied.
translatedText: 为了得到这个符号，你可以说，当右下角的数字保持不变时，顶 部的数字就像是 O 加在一起，而左下角的数字就像是相乘。

input: This is actually a really nice connection between logarithms and roots, and it never gets discussed, probably because the notation isn't really conducive to asking the question.
translatedText: 这实际上是对数和根之间非常好的联系，但它从未被讨 论过，可能是因为这种符号并不真正有利于提出问题。

input: I could go on and on here, showing a lot of other properties, but honestly, I think the best case I can make here is to encourage you to explore it for yourself, and notice that just about everything involving exponents, logs, or radicals becomes nicer when you use the triangle of power.
translatedText: 我可以在这里继续展示很多其他属性，但老实说 ，我认为我在这里可以做的最好的例子是鼓励您 自己探索它，并注意几乎所有涉及指数、对数或 根式的东西当你使用权力三角时，会变得更好。

input: By the way, I hope that it goes without saying that in this perfect world, students wouldn't learn these operations purely from the symbols.
translatedText: 顺便说一句，我希望不用说，在这个完美的世 界里，学生不会纯粹从符号中学习这些运算。

input: They should still ask why it's true, and why it doesn't follow a different pattern.
translatedText: 他们仍然应该问为什么这是真的，以及为什么它不遵循不同的模式。

input: But the point is that when the notation actually reflects the math, the questions that students are most naturally asking tend to be the ones that cut right into the essence of what's going on.
translatedText: 但关键是，当符号真正反映数学时，学 生最自然地提出的问题往往是那些直接 切入正在发生的事情的本质的问题。

input: The asymmetries in the notation correspond with actual asymmetries in the numerical relationship a to the b equals c itself, not in the artificial asymmetries of squiggles and words.
translatedText: 符号中的不对称性对应于数字关系a到b等于c本身的 实际不对称性，而不是曲线和文字的人为不对称性。

input: When a student asks why the top likes to get added in one context but O-plussed in another, the teacher can point out the property that reflecting the triangle reciprocates the top, and then they can start addressing where that fact comes from.
translatedText: 当学生问为什么顶部喜欢在一种情况下相加，但在另一种 情况下喜欢O加时，老师可以指出反映三角形与顶部互 相关的性质，然后他们可以开始解决这个事实的来源。

input: My sincere hope is that students don't learn by symbolic patterns, but by substantive reasoning and re-derivation within their own heads.
translatedText: 我真诚地希望学生不要通过符号模式来学习，而是 通过自己头脑中的实质性推理和重新推导来学习。

input: But the fact is, most of us do first learn things by symbolic manipulation, so when there's an opportunity to significantly speed up that process, we should take it!
translatedText: 但事实是，我们大多数人首先通过符号操作来学习东西， 所以当有机会显着加快这个过程时，我们应该抓住它！

input: And if you agree with me that the triangle of power is clearly better than what we have already, start actually using it in your notes to see what it feels like, spread the word, and if you're a teacher, maybe start teaching this to your students so that we can get them hooked while they're young.
translatedText: 如果你同意我的观点，即权力三角显然比我们现有的更好 ，请开始在你的笔记中实际使用它，看看它的感觉，传 播信息，如果你是一名老师，也许可以开始教授这个给您 的学生，以便我们可以在他们年轻的时候让他们着迷。
